DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time recorded using a 24-hour clock when an oral contrast agent was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Oral; of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/17/17 tt New DEC per Rnd 5 finalization task.  Supercedes DEC 2717628.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/30/17 jk transferred context; added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 8/29/13 curated for the CFR Standardization work. tt
